text:
ATPCO is an airline-owned
technology company.
We have over 450 airlines
that we collect their data,
process it, provide technology solutions.

Essentially, we're the
foundation of flight shopping
for the entire world.

Things like AWS Skills 
Guild gives the foundation

for those employees to take 
control of their own career paths,

gives them the skills that they're
going to need for the future,

and most importantly, lets them
know that their employer

cares about them and will
continue to invest in them.
For us, it is much better for us

to train our existing
employees on new skills

than it is to take people
that have those skills
and try and train them on our industry.
So it has probably shortened the time

for our employees to be
effective by 18 to 24 months.
Very often, when you think about
how you solve problems in the cloud,

it's not just a change of
the technology infrastructure
that you're using.
It's a change in the mindset.

Think about an environment
in which we are collecting

the shopping data of
every airline worldwide.

We're talking about
petabytes worth of data.
With the skills that my team is learning,
we can now build an infrastructure
that can house all of this information,

and it really changes how
we work with our customers.

Instead of us redistributing
petabytes of information
to hundreds of of customers,

we're actually saying,
"Everybody come to us.
Bring your compute to us,

and we'll have one copy of the
data that everybody can use."
This is a radical rethink

of what distribution
means in our business.
